meanings.sent1: The children reenacted their favorite story during playtime.
meanings.sent2: The actors reenacted the final scene of the play for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat reenacted its failed attempt to catch the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter reenacted the sound of wind chimes on a breezy day.
meanings.sent5: The students reenacted the eruption of a volcano using baking soda and vinegar.

meanings.definition: To perform again, as a play or scene
meanings.sent1: The students reenacted their school play for their families at home.
meanings.sent2: The theater group reenacted a famous Shakespearean play on stage.
meanings.sent3: The robot reenacted its dance routine with mechanical precision.
meanings.sent4: His smile reenacted the warmth of a summer sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The children reenacted the moon landing using a cardboard spaceship.

meanings.definition: To repeat an action or event, typically for historical or educational purposes
meanings.sent1: The class reenacted the signing of the Declaration of Independence for history class.
meanings.sent2: The museum visitors watched as actors reenacted life in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel reenacted its successful acorn-hiding technique from last winter.
meanings.sent4: Her tears reenacted a waterfall cascading down a rocky cliff.
meanings.sent5: The reenacted battle brought history to life for the students.
